intro:
'{},
	what have you gotten yourself into. You left me again. This time without a single word. I have managed to track you down,
	but I have no intention of stopping you. Do what you want to. I spoke to the chief, apparently there is some kind of curse stemming from a local legend.
	Maybe he could tell you more about this quest of yours. That is, if your quest is still to cleanse
	the forsaken city of Talematros, and your father with it, from the Void'.
'It is,' you whisper to yourself. The letter ends unsigned, but you know it's just your mother being worried again.
combat:
In this strange land, your enemies will try to kill you not physically, but mentally. Instead of fighting with swords and bows,
they play a game known as 'Nim'. Players remove 1-3 stones on each turn from a pile of 21 stones that magically appears
whenever a duel starts. As you are a stranger in this land, you always go second, but you never die from a single fight.
The goal is to get the pile to 0 and whoever does so, subjugates the opponents soul, gianing their strengh and recieving what they have to offer.

You open it and obtain Zandalars's staff, just as Alberimus foretold.
pre_boss:
'So we meet again.' you hear in your head. 'I am Zandalar, The Unseen, Leader of the Void and... your father.
Now you shall succumb to the corruption or die, trying to resist it.'
boss_def:
'Thank you son, for freeing me from the corruption. You have done well, I am proud of you.' With these final words, Zandalar's soul leaves his body.
The Shard from alchemist starts to shake and teleports you to her village. The crown you gained (if you accepted the offer) can be sold for 1000 coins.
You have finished the game!
You can continue playing the game for as long as you like, but there will be no more story. You can always leave the game using the 'exit' command.

You find yourself near the chief's hut in the village of Khayda. There is also a market and an alchemist's hut nearby.
